attributes.action: Cancel the subsidisation of expenses for MPs.
attributes.additional_details: Personal responsibility matters. Members of Parliament earn a sufficient enough salary to budget the purchasing and running of their own food, transport costs and household bills without having to rely on the country’s welfare system. Financial independence should be encouraged and therefore, all financial aid to Members of Parliament should be halted in order to achieve this.
attributes.background: I would like to see all subsidies for MPs expenses cut. Members of Parliament have, for too long, had an over reliance on these subsidies and have subsequently fallen into a cycle of state dependency.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out how to contact IPSA here:

http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/
